titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 256: Manual of a Venetian consigliere, written for Giovanni Francesco Basadonna

notesStmt.note: No title given in the manuscript.
Signed by Marc Antonio Padavia (f. 57r), who might be the author as well as the scribe.
No date in manuscript; date taken from Zacour-Hirsch Catalogue and from seller's note (on file in the Library).
Cover wearing at spine; evidence of worm damage to cover. Paper endleaves stained, with a few wormholes.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Manual of a Venetian consigliere, an assistant to the mayor of Venice, outlining the duties of his office. It also gives valuable information on the setup of the Venetian city administration. There are chapters on balloting, the handling of shipwrecked merchandise, the famous "Concilio de'Dieci," the issuing of passports, the court of justice and many other subjects. This manuscript was written for Giovanni Francesco Basadonna, and it begins with the oath he swore to his superior (f. 1v). (The spelling "Basadonna" seems certain; "Basadona," as on the spine of the slipcase, seems to be a misinterpretation of the name as given on f. 1v.)

msItem.title: Manual of a Venetian consigliere, written for Giovanni Francesco Basadonna
Scribe's signature, Marc Antonio Padavia, f. 57r

supportDesc.extent: 60 leaves : 228 x 156 (154 x 103) mm. bound to 236 x 166 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, iii+ 60 + iii; [iii], 1-60, [iii], contemporary arabic numerals, upper right recto. The unnumbered leaves at the front at back are paper endleaves.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a single cursive hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Full-page painting (f. 1r) in vivid colors depicting the patron saints of Basadonna, St. Francis of Assisi and St. John the Apostle, against a mountainous background in a gold ornamental frame. Above them, inset into the frame as a miniature, is the Venetian patron St. Mark depicted (as is customary) as a lion. Opening words in gold, chapter headings in red.
Miniature, St. Francis of Assisi and St. John the Apostle, f. 1r
Owner's stamp, Comes Hercules Silva, f. 57v

binding.p: Contemporary red velvet over boards. In a modern slipcase.
